intro: Balsamea meccanensis, commonly known as the Meccan balsam, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found growing in shaded, moist crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
